questions.text: People who know my commitments and ask if I've followed through are ...

answers.5: my accountability partners — they always ask
answers.3: some — a few people in a few areas
answers.1: none — I keep my commitments to myself

questions.text: Telling people my goals so they can hold me accountable is ...

answers.5: built in — accountability is part of goal-setting
answers.2: rare — only when I have to
answers.1: something I avoid — I keep goals private

questions.text: Holding others accountable for their commitments is ...

answers.5: mutual — I hold and am held accountable
answers.2: rare — I hint but don't push
answers.1: not my role — I don't do that

questions.text: When I fail to follow through, telling accountability partners honestly is ...

answers.4: usual — I tell them even when it's hard
answers.2: hard — I often minimize or delay

questions.text: My execution accountability relationships improving my follow-through is ...

answers.3: moderate — some improvement in some areas
answers.1: not happening — I don't have these

remediation.advice: Execution accountability only works if you're honest about failures and if your partners actually follow up. Most 'accountability' is theater — people ask, you give vague answers, no one pushes. Find people who will actually hold you to your word, and be that person for others.

scripture.text: Faithful are the wounds of a friend; profuse are the kisses of an enemy.
